topic: How to profile notebooks to production using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to profile notebooks to production using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Profiling Notebooks for Production with FastAPI using Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to profile Jupyter notebooks and optimize them for efficient production deployment using FastAPI, a modern web framework in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understanding the difference between notebook and production environments
Converting Jupyter notebooks to FastAPI endpoints
Managing version control in a production environment

code_examples.code:
```
# Example of using cProfile module for profiling
import cProfile
import pstats
cProfile.run('your_function()')
p = pstats.Stats(sort=pstats.SortKey.TIME)
p.strip_dirs().print_stats()
```

version_notes: FastAPI version: Latest stable release (as of the writing this answer: FastAPI 0.75)
caveats: Notebook-to-FastAPI conversion can be complex and requires a good understanding of both Jupyter notebooks and web development with FastAPI
Profiling may not always provide accurate results, especially when dealing with concurrent requests or asynchronous tasks in production
Ensure to properly handle input validation, authentication, and error handling for secure and robust API endpoints
